00120                 LPC_GPDMACH2,   // GPDMA Channel 2

00190 /* Public Functions ----------------------------------------------------------- */
00195 /********************************************************************/
00200 void GPDMA_Init(void)
00201 {
00202         /* Enable GPDMA clock */
00203         CLKPWR_ConfigPPWR (CLKPWR_PCONP_PCGPDMA, ENABLE);
00204 
00205         // Reset all channel configuration register
00206         LPC_GPDMACH0->DMACCConfig = 0;
00207         LPC_GPDMACH1->DMACCConfig = 0;
00208         LPC_GPDMACH2->DMACCConfig = 0;
00209         LPC_GPDMACH3->DMACCConfig = 0;
00210         LPC_GPDMACH4->DMACCConfig = 0;
00211         LPC_GPDMACH5->DMACCConfig = 0;
00212         LPC_GPDMACH6->DMACCConfig = 0;
00213         LPC_GPDMACH7->DMACCConfig = 0;
00214 
00215         /* Clear all DMA interrupt and error flag */
00216         LPC_GPDMA->DMACIntTCClear = 0xFF;
00217         LPC_GPDMA->DMACIntErrClr = 0xFF;
00218 }
00219 
00220 /********************************************************************/
00229 Status GPDMA_Setup(GPDMA_Channel_CFG_Type *GPDMAChannelConfig)
00230 {
00231         LPC_GPDMACH_TypeDef *pDMAch;
00232         uint32_t tmp1, tmp2;
00233 
00234         if (LPC_GPDMA->DMACEnbldChns & (GPDMA_DMACEnbldChns_Ch(GPDMAChannelConfig->ChannelNum))) {
00235                 // This channel is enabled, return ERROR, need to release this channel first
00236                 return ERROR;
00237         }
00238 
00239         // Get Channel pointer
00240         pDMAch = (LPC_GPDMACH_TypeDef *) pGPDMACh[GPDMAChannelConfig->ChannelNum];
00241 
00242         // Reset the Interrupt status
00243         LPC_GPDMA->DMACIntTCClear = GPDMA_DMACIntTCClear_Ch(GPDMAChannelConfig->ChannelNum);
00244         LPC_GPDMA->DMACIntErrClr = GPDMA_DMACIntErrClr_Ch(GPDMAChannelConfig->ChannelNum);
00245 
00246         // Clear DMA configure
00247         pDMAch->DMACCControl = 0x00;
00248         pDMAch->DMACCConfig = 0x00;
00249 
00250         /* Assign Linker List Item value */
00251         pDMAch->DMACCLLI = GPDMAChannelConfig->DMALLI;
00252 
00253         /* Set value to Channel Control Registers */
00254         switch (GPDMAChannelConfig->TransferType)
00255         {
00256         // Memory to memory
00257         case GPDMA_TRANSFERTYPE_M2M:
00258                 // Assign physical source and destination address
00259                 pDMAch->DMACCSrcAddr = GPDMAChannelConfig->SrcMemAddr;
00260                 pDMAch->DMACCDestAddr = GPDMAChannelConfig->DstMemAddr;
00261                 pDMAch->DMACCControl
00262                                 = GPDMA_DMACCxControl_TransferSize(GPDMAChannelConfig->TransferSize) \
00263                                                 | GPDMA_DMACCxControl_SBSize(GPDMA_BSIZE_32) \
00264                                                 | GPDMA_DMACCxControl_DBSize(GPDMA_BSIZE_32) \
00265                                                 | GPDMA_DMACCxControl_SWidth(GPDMAChannelConfig->TransferWidth) \
00266                                                 | GPDMA_DMACCxControl_DWidth(GPDMAChannelConfig->TransferWidth) \
00267                                                 | GPDMA_DMACCxControl_SI \
00268                                                 | GPDMA_DMACCxControl_DI \
00269                                                 | GPDMA_DMACCxControl_I;
00270                 break;
00271         // Memory to peripheral
00272         case GPDMA_TRANSFERTYPE_M2P:
00273                 // Assign physical source
00274                 pDMAch->DMACCSrcAddr = GPDMAChannelConfig->SrcMemAddr;
00275                 // Assign peripheral destination address
00276                 pDMAch->DMACCDestAddr = (uint32_t)GPDMA_LUTPerAddr[GPDMAChannelConfig->DstConn];
00277                 pDMAch->DMACCControl
00278                                 = GPDMA_DMACCxControl_TransferSize((uint32_t)GPDMAChannelConfig->TransferSize) \
00279                                                 | GPDMA_DMACCxControl_SBSize((uint32_t)GPDMA_LUTPerBurst[GPDMAChannelConfig->DstConn]) \
00280                                                 | GPDMA_DMACCxControl_DBSize((uint32_t)GPDMA_LUTPerBurst[GPDMAChannelConfig->DstConn]) \
00281                                                 | GPDMA_DMACCxControl_SWidth((uint32_t)GPDMA_LUTPerWid[GPDMAChannelConfig->DstConn]) \
00282                                                 | GPDMA_DMACCxControl_DWidth((uint32_t)GPDMA_LUTPerWid[GPDMAChannelConfig->DstConn]) \
00283                                                 | GPDMA_DMACCxControl_SI \
00284                                                 | GPDMA_DMACCxControl_I;
00285                 break;
00286         // Peripheral to memory
00287         case GPDMA_TRANSFERTYPE_P2M:
00288                 // Assign peripheral source address
00289                 pDMAch->DMACCSrcAddr = (uint32_t)GPDMA_LUTPerAddr[GPDMAChannelConfig->SrcConn];
00290                 // Assign memory destination address
00291                 pDMAch->DMACCDestAddr = GPDMAChannelConfig->DstMemAddr;
00292                 pDMAch->DMACCControl
00293                                 = GPDMA_DMACCxControl_TransferSize((uint32_t)GPDMAChannelConfig->TransferSize) \
00294                                                 | GPDMA_DMACCxControl_SBSize((uint32_t)GPDMA_LUTPerBurst[GPDMAChannelConfig->SrcConn]) \
00295                                                 | GPDMA_DMACCxControl_DBSize((uint32_t)GPDMA_LUTPerBurst[GPDMAChannelConfig->SrcConn]) \
00296                                                 | GPDMA_DMACCxControl_SWidth((uint32_t)GPDMA_LUTPerWid[GPDMAChannelConfig->SrcConn]) \
00297                                                 | GPDMA_DMACCxControl_DWidth((uint32_t)GPDMA_LUTPerWid[GPDMAChannelConfig->SrcConn]) \
00298                                                 | GPDMA_DMACCxControl_DI \
00299                                                 | GPDMA_DMACCxControl_I;
00300                 break;
00301         // Peripheral to peripheral
00302         case GPDMA_TRANSFERTYPE_P2P:
00303                 // Assign peripheral source address
00304                 pDMAch->DMACCSrcAddr = (uint32_t)GPDMA_LUTPerAddr[GPDMAChannelConfig->SrcConn];
00305                 // Assign peripheral destination address
00306                 pDMAch->DMACCDestAddr = (uint32_t)GPDMA_LUTPerAddr[GPDMAChannelConfig->DstConn];
00307                 pDMAch->DMACCControl
00308                                 = GPDMA_DMACCxControl_TransferSize((uint32_t)GPDMAChannelConfig->TransferSize) \
00309                                                 | GPDMA_DMACCxControl_SBSize((uint32_t)GPDMA_LUTPerBurst[GPDMAChannelConfig->SrcConn]) \
00310                                                 | GPDMA_DMACCxControl_DBSize((uint32_t)GPDMA_LUTPerBurst[GPDMAChannelConfig->DstConn]) \
00311                                                 | GPDMA_DMACCxControl_SWidth((uint32_t)GPDMA_LUTPerWid[GPDMAChannelConfig->SrcConn]) \
00312                                                 | GPDMA_DMACCxControl_DWidth((uint32_t)GPDMA_LUTPerWid[GPDMAChannelConfig->DstConn]) \
00313                                                 | GPDMA_DMACCxControl_I;
00314                 break;
00315         // Do not support any more transfer type, return ERROR
00316         default:
00317                 return ERROR;
00318         }
00319 
00320         /* Re-Configure DMA Request Select for source peripheral */
00321         if (GPDMAChannelConfig->SrcConn > 15)
00322         {
00323                 DMAREQSEL |= (1<<(GPDMAChannelConfig->SrcConn - 16));
00324         } else {
00325                 DMAREQSEL &= ~(1<<(GPDMAChannelConfig->SrcConn - 8));
00326         }
00327 
00328         /* Re-Configure DMA Request Select for Destination peripheral */
00329         if (GPDMAChannelConfig->DstConn > 15)
00330         {
00331                 DMAREQSEL |= (1<<(GPDMAChannelConfig->DstConn - 16));
00332         } else {
00333                 DMAREQSEL &= ~(1<<(GPDMAChannelConfig->DstConn - 8));
00334         }
00335 
00336         /* Enable DMA channels, little endian */
00337         LPC_GPDMA->DMACConfig = GPDMA_DMACConfig_E;
00338         while (!(LPC_GPDMA->DMACConfig & GPDMA_DMACConfig_E));
00339 
00340         // Calculate absolute value for Connection number
00341         tmp1 = GPDMAChannelConfig->SrcConn;
00342         tmp1 = ((tmp1 > 15) ? (tmp1 - 8) : tmp1);
00343         tmp2 = GPDMAChannelConfig->DstConn;
00344         tmp2 = ((tmp2 > 15) ? (tmp2 - 8) : tmp2);
00345 
00346         // Configure DMA Channel, enable Error Counter and Terminate counter
00347         pDMAch->DMACCConfig = GPDMA_DMACCxConfig_IE | GPDMA_DMACCxConfig_ITC /*| GPDMA_DMACCxConfig_E*/ \
00348                 | GPDMA_DMACCxConfig_TransferType((uint32_t)GPDMAChannelConfig->TransferType) \
00349                 | GPDMA_DMACCxConfig_SrcPeripheral(tmp1) \
00350                 | GPDMA_DMACCxConfig_DestPeripheral(tmp2);
00351 
00352         return SUCCESS;
00353 }
00354

00356 /*********************************************************************/
00364 void GPDMA_ChannelCmd(uint8_t channelNum, FunctionalState NewState)
00365 {
00366         LPC_GPDMACH_TypeDef *pDMAch;
00367 
00368         // Get Channel pointer
00369         pDMAch = (LPC_GPDMACH_TypeDef *) pGPDMACh[channelNum];
00370 
00371         if (NewState == ENABLE) {
00372                 pDMAch->DMACCConfig |= GPDMA_DMACCxConfig_E;
00373         } else {
00374                 pDMAch->DMACCConfig &= ~GPDMA_DMACCxConfig_E;
00375         }
00376 }
00377 /*********************************************************************/
00393 IntStatus GPDMA_IntGetStatus(GPDMA_Status_Type type, uint8_t channel)
00394 {
00395         CHECK_PARAM(PARAM_GPDMA_STAT(type));
00396         CHECK_PARAM(PARAM_GPDMA_CHANNEL(channel));
00397 
00398         switch (type)
00399         {
00400         case GPDMA_STAT_INT: //check status of DMA channel interrupts
00401                 if (LPC_GPDMA->DMACIntStat & (GPDMA_DMACIntStat_Ch(channel)))
00402                         return SET;
00403                 return RESET;
00404         case GPDMA_STAT_INTTC: // check terminal count interrupt request status for DMA
00405                 if (LPC_GPDMA->DMACIntTCStat & GPDMA_DMACIntTCStat_Ch(channel))
00406                         return SET;
00407                 return RESET;
00408         case GPDMA_STAT_INTERR: //check interrupt status for DMA channels
00409                 if (LPC_GPDMA->DMACIntErrStat & GPDMA_DMACIntTCClear_Ch(channel))
00410                         return SET;
00411                 return RESET;
00412         case GPDMA_STAT_RAWINTTC: //check status of the terminal count interrupt for DMA channels
00413                 if (LPC_GPDMA->DMACRawIntErrStat & GPDMA_DMACRawIntTCStat_Ch(channel))
00414                         return SET;
00415                 return RESET;
00416         case GPDMA_STAT_RAWINTERR: //check status of the error interrupt for DMA channels
00417                 if (LPC_GPDMA->DMACRawIntTCStat & GPDMA_DMACRawIntErrStat_Ch(channel))
00418                         return SET;
00419                 return RESET;
00420         default: //check enable status for DMA channels
00421                 if (LPC_GPDMA->DMACEnbldChns & GPDMA_DMACEnbldChns_Ch(channel))
00422                         return SET;
00423                 return RESET;
00424         }
00425 }
00426 
00427 /*********************************************************************/
00435 void GPDMA_ClearIntPending(GPDMA_StateClear_Type type, uint8_t channel)
00436 {
00437         CHECK_PARAM(PARAM_GPDMA_STATCLR(type));
00438         CHECK_PARAM(PARAM_GPDMA_CHANNEL(channel));
00439 
00440         if (type == GPDMA_STATCLR_INTTC) // clears the terminal count interrupt request on DMA channel
00441                 LPC_GPDMA->DMACIntTCClear = GPDMA_DMACIntTCClear_Ch(channel);
00442         else // clear the error interrupt request
00443                 LPC_GPDMA->DMACIntErrClr = GPDMA_DMACIntErrClr_Ch(channel);
00444 }
